content: section 3 of the small feather pattern section 4 row 1 kf&b k to end 16 sts row 2 kf&b k6 p1 k8 17 sts row 3 kf&b k6 s2kp2 k7 16 sts row 4 kf&b k6 p1 k8 17 sts repeat row 3 & 4 three more times there will be 20 ridges shaping the top row 1 k7 s2kp2 k7 15 sts row 2 k7 p1 k7 row 3 kf&b k5 s2kp2 k6 14 sts row 4 kf&b k5 p1 k7 15 sts row 5 k6 s2kp2 k6 13 sts row 6 k6 p1 k6 row 7 ssk k3 s2kp2 k3 k2tog 9 sts row 8 k4 p1 k4 row 9 k3 s2kp2 k3 7 sts row 10 k3 p1 k3 row 11 ssk s2kp2 k2tog 3 sts cast off with the double decrease cast off as before both sizes of feather dk on the left and 4 ply on the right as well as using plain or variegated yarn you can also play around with stripes or you can add a long tail of i cord and some beads or bells to make a bookmark you can also stiffen the feathers with starch abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl m1 make 1 by lifting the thread before the next stitch and knitting into the back of it kf&b knit into the front and back of the stitch s2kp2 slip two stitches as if to knit them together knit one stitch and pass slipped stitches over two stitches decreased i cord knit every row but don t turn the work at the end of row just pull the yarn round from behind the stitches and carry on © frankie brown 2018 my patterns are for personal use only and should not be used to knit items for sale please do not use them for teaching purposes without my permission
